page.title: 12THE MANOR HOUSE,LEASINGHAM.
page.content: The{Manor House}is situated on the B1209,in the South of the village.It was{built in 1550}and altered up to the 1800's.There is a late Georgian Gothic-detailed porch and hidden behind the garden wall is a grand s-front,identical to that of a house in Stamford-13,Barn Hall-of 1740.The rusticated ground floor windows have stepped keystones,and the upper windows have triangular pediments. The present owner has lived there for 18 years.He is a farmer and landowner,who owns 2,700 acres on the {Roxholm Estate.}From the age of 12,he was taken around{antique shops.}An interest in antiques developed and he started a shop in the village of {Ancaster-}nine miles away- selling antique porcelain.He also has stalls in{Newark Super Market}and at{Woburn {Abbey}dealing in furniture.
